result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
10:32 AM Defendant Shawn V Vanzile appeared by video, in custody - appears from Sand Ridge Treatment Facility.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court.  Attorney Alexander Paul Seifert in court for State of Wisconsin. Court reviews file, no SPD yet, continues bond, set for another AIA. Court sets for AIA on 11/30/22 at 10:00 AM, JA to make arrangements for Zoom from Sand Ridge.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 30, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on November 30, 2022 at 10:00 am.
SPD Update

10:56 AM Defendant Shawn V Vanzile appeared by video from Sand Ridge Secure Treatment Center.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court, in custody.  Attorney Alexander Paul Seifert in court for State of Wisconsin. Court reviews file, asks if defendant contacted SPD. Vanzile states he has not because he was waiting for a court appointed attorney. Court instructs that it cannot appoint an attorney until it finds out if he is eligible for SPD, reminds him of his options for counsel, SPD first - private hire - court appointed - represent self. Vanzile states he does know how to contact SPD but states he is only allowed 20 minutes for a phone call. Court continues bond, sets for another AIA on 10/19/22 at 10:30 AM - will still be in Sand Ridge, contact SPD right away, gives ramifications of appearing again without counsel.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on October 19, 2022 at 10:30 am.

10:51 AM Prosecuting attorney Alexander Paul Seifert in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Shawn V Vanzile appeared by video.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court, in custody and appears from Sand Ridge Correctional Institute. Court reviews file, defendant will be in Sand Ridge Correctional until at least 2023. Court quashes warrant. Vanzile has complaint. Court reads charges and penalties and right to attorney and court appointed attorney. Vanzile understands charges and penalties. Court directs defendant to contact SPD, sets bond at $1,000.00 signature bond - must sign and return to COC within 10 days, set for AIA on 9/7/22 at 10:30 AM.
